data.text:
Michael W. Smith is a renowned contemporary Christian music artist, songwriter, and worship leader. Born on October 7, 1957, in Kenova, West Virginia, he has been a pivotal figure in the Christian music scene since the early 1980s. Smith’s music blends pop, rock, and worship elements, appealing to a broad audience. He has released numerous successful albums, including *”Worship,” “Worship Again,”* and *”Sovereign,”* and is known for hit songs like “Friends,” “Above All,” and “Agnus Dei.” Smith has received multiple Grammy and Dove Awards, reflecting his impact and contribution to Christian music. Beyond his musical career, he is also an author and active philanthropist.

1. Friends

“Friends” is a classic song by Michael W. Smith, co-written with his wife, Deborah D. Smith. Released in 1983 on his debut album *Michael W. Smith Project*, the song has become an anthem of enduring friendship and faith. Its heartfelt lyrics and simple, poignant melody convey a message of support and love, emphasizing the spiritual bond that transcends physical separation. “Friends” is often performed at graduations, farewells, and memorial services, resonating deeply with audiences for its comforting and uplifting message. Over the years, it has solidified its place as one of Michael W. Smith’s most beloved and enduring songs.

2. Place in This World

“Place in This World” is a song by Michael W. Smith, released in 1990 as part of his album *Go West Young Man*. Co-written by Smith, Amy Grant, and Wayne Kirkpatrick, the song became one of Smith’s biggest hits, reaching number 6 on the Billboard Hot 100. It is a contemporary Christian song that explores themes of searching for meaning and purpose in life. With its heartfelt lyrics and powerful melody, “Place in This World” resonated with a wide audience, both within the Christian music community and beyond, solidifying Michael W. Smith’s status as a prominent figure in contemporary Christian music.

3. Agnus Dei

“Agnus Dei” is a powerful worship song by Michael W. Smith, originally released on his 1990 album *Go West Young Man*. The song takes its name from the Latin phrase meaning “Lamb of God,” a title for Jesus Christ derived from the Christian liturgy. “Agnus Dei” is characterized by its simple yet profound lyrics, which repeat the phrase “Alleluia” and praise God, creating an atmosphere of reverence and worship. The song has been widely embraced by churches and worship leaders around the world for its heartfelt devotion and stirring melody. Its timeless appeal continues to inspire and uplift believers in their faith.

4. Above All

“Above All” is a powerful worship song by Michael W. Smith, featured on his 2001 album *Worship*. Co-written by Paul Baloche and Lenny LeBlanc, the song highlights the supremacy and sacrificial love of Jesus Christ. With its poignant lyrics and moving melody, “Above All” captures the essence of Christ’s sacrifice on the cross, portraying His love as “above all powers, above all kings.” Smith’s heartfelt performance and the song’s reflective nature make it a staple in contemporary worship services. “Above All” has touched countless hearts, becoming a beloved anthem that inspires deep reverence and gratitude in Christian worship.

5. Open the Eyes of My Heart

“Open the Eyes of My Heart” is a contemporary Christian worship song written and originally performed by Paul Baloche. Released in 2000 on his album *Open the Eyes of My Heart*, the song quickly became popular in Christian worship services due to its heartfelt plea for spiritual enlightenment and deeper connection with God. The lyrics, centered around the repeated plea “Open the eyes of my heart, Lord,” reflect a desire for greater spiritual vision and understanding. The song’s simple, melodic structure and earnest message have made it a staple in modern worship music, resonating with congregations and worship leaders around the world.

6. Breathe

“Breathe” is a deeply moving worship song performed by Michael W. Smith, featured on his 2001 album *Worship*. Originally written by Marie Barnett, the song has become a staple in contemporary Christian worship. Its simple yet profound lyrics express a deep yearning for God’s presence, with the chorus proclaiming, “This is the air I breathe, Your holy presence living in me.” The song emphasizes the necessity of God’s presence in the believer’s life, likening it to the air we breathe and the sustenance we need. Smith’s rendition, with its passionate delivery and atmospheric arrangement, has made “Breathe” a beloved and enduring worship anthem that resonates deeply with listeners, fostering a spirit of reflection and intimacy with God.

7. Healing Rain

“Healing Rain” is a song by Michael W. Smith, released in 2004 as the title track of his album *Healing Rain*. The song is a contemporary Christian worship anthem that speaks of God’s healing power and the renewal that comes through His presence. With its uplifting melody and evocative lyrics, “Healing Rain” has become a favorite in worship services, offering hope and comfort to listeners. The song’s powerful message of spiritual and emotional healing, combined with Smith’s heartfelt performance, has made it a significant and enduring piece in his musical repertoire.

8. Mighty to Save

“Mighty to Save” is a worship song popularized by Hillsong Worship, co-written by Ben Fielding and Reuben Morgan. It was first featured on Hillsong’s 2006 album of the same name. The song’s lyrics focus on the redemptive power and saving grace of Jesus Christ, proclaiming Him as “mighty to save” and acknowledging His ability to heal, forgive, and restore. “Mighty to Save” has become a widely sung anthem in churches worldwide, known for its powerful message and uplifting melody. It encourages believers to place their trust in Christ’s saving power and to spread His message of hope and salvation to the world.

9. Draw Me Close

“Draw Me Close” is a worship song written by Kelly Carpenter in 1994. It gained popularity after being recorded by various artists, including Michael W. Smith on his album *Worship* in 2001. The song expresses a longing for intimacy with God, using the imagery of being drawn close to Him. Its heartfelt lyrics and simple melody make it a favorite in Christian worship settings, often sung as a prayerful expression of surrender and desire for God’s presence. “Draw Me Close” has resonated with many for its profound message of seeking closeness with the divine.

10. Sovereign Over Us

“Sovereign Over Us” is a worship song performed by Michael W. Smith, featured on his 2014 album *Sovereign*. Co-written by Aaron Keyes, Bryan Brown, and Jack Mooring, the song reflects on God’s sovereignty and faithfulness in every circumstance of life. Its lyrics affirm that God is in control, even in times of difficulty and uncertainty, and that His plans are always for our good. The song emphasizes trust and reliance on God’s providence, declaring His power and love over all things. “Sovereign Over Us” has resonated with many listeners for its comforting message and powerful expression of faith.
